summary:
* Extensive experience in liquid chromatography analysis for peptide and proteins. 2 years of experience in biopharmaceutical industry specializing in promoting analytical and production of biologics.  
* Experienced in a range of biophysical tools for molecular attribute assessment, such as CE-SDS, SEC, CEX, DLS, CD, UV-Vis, Fluorescence Spectrometry, Atomic-spectrometry, MS, HPLC-MS, Amino Acid Analysis
* Experienced in a range of in vitro biochemical tools, such as bacteria culturing, mammalian cell (adherent or detached) culturing, live cell imaging
*Knowledge in regulated documentation in biopharmaceutical environment, including method validation and qualification, sample management, Electronic lab notebook. 
*Instrument maintaining and troubling shooting
*Self-motivated, attention to details, cooperative and team playing
headline: Sr. Technical Product Manager at SCIEX

publications.description: Makeover of an old antibiotic: The channel-forming toxin gramicidin A (gA) has been successfully converted into agents that selectively chase after bacterial cells. These novel d-Lys-containing gA mutants display potent antimicrobial activity and remarkable therapeutic indexes (>1000-fold).
publications.name: Solubilized Gramicidin A as potential systemic antibiotics

publications.description: Cyclic peptides (cLacs) are designed to mimic the natural phosphatidylserine (PS) binding protein lactadherin. Unlike annexin V or its small molecule mimics, the cLac peptides selectively target PS-presenting membranes with no need for metal cofactors. We further show that a fluorophore-labeled cLac effectively stains early apoptotic cells. The small size and facile conjugation with a variety of imaging tracers make the cLac design promising for imaging cell death in vitro as well as in living organisms.
publications.name: Cofactor-free Detection of Phosphatidylserine with Cyclic Peptides Mimicking Lactadherin

publications.description: Lighting up protein dimers in membranes: The association of membrane proteins plays a critical role in biology. We describe a FlAsH–tetracysteine (tC) assay that detects protein dimerization in lipid bilayers with a fluorescent readout. The stringent spatial requirement of FlAsH–tC complex formation readily differentiates helix dimers in parallel and antiparallel orientations.
publications.name: A FlAsH-tetracysteine Assay for Quantifying the Association and Orientation of Transmembrane alpha-helices

publications.description: “Smart” peptides that lyse membranes in response to biological stimuli are of considerable interest. Herein, we report a facile synthesis of l-tetrafluorotyrosine (l-f4Y) and its utilization as a pH sensing element. The synthetic route affords gram quantities of l-f4Y within two days. Incorporation of this unnatural amino acid into magainin 2 gives a peptide that turns on its membrane-lytic activity upon mild acidification.
publications.name: Facile synthesis of tetrafluorotyrosine and its application in pH triggered membrane lysis

publications.description: The Sudan virus MPER peptide was found to moderately inhibit cell entry by a GP-pseudotyped vesicular stomatitis virus but did not induce leakage of a fluorescent molecule from a large unilammellar vesicle comprised of 1-palmitoyl-2-oleoylphosphatidylcholine or cause hemolysis. Taken together, this analysis suggests the filovirus GP2 MPER binds and inserts shallowly into lipid membranes.
publications.name: Conformational Properties of Peptides Corresponding to the Ebolavirus GP2 Membrane-Proximal External Region in the Presence of Micelle-Forming Surfactants and Lipids

publications.description: Protein-membrane interactions underlie numerous biological processes including the folding of ion channels and signal transduction across lipid membranes. A detailed understanding of protein-lipid interactions is critical for designing membrane-active peptides as potential antibiotics as well. Using gramicidin A (gA) as a model system, we investigated the effects of lysine methylation on peptide folding into transmembrane channels. The results are discussed in terms of the peptides' binding affinity to, translocation across, and structure formation in lipid membranes. The results show that gA mutants with Nε-trimethylated D-lysines (dMe3K) are capable of folding into wild type-like channels that are selective for monovalent cations. Surprisingly, Nε-trimethylation in general reduces the peptide's binding affinity to lipid membranes despite the increased hydrophobicity. Further investigation reveals the critical contribution of the hydrogen bonding potential of lysine side chains to peptide-membrane association, which has previously been underappreciated. Importantly, methylation does give improved therapeutic indices for certain combinations of gA variant and bacterium, indicating that methylation can be an effective strategy to fine tune the performance of peptide antibiotics.
publications.name: Effects of Lysine Methylation on Gramicidin A Folding in Lipid Membranes
Rapid, automated characterization of disulde bond scrambling and IgG2 isoformdetermination

message.text: very impressive and creative. sometimes we just need to have an open mind and want to discover😀

GAMIFICATION is transforming both Parenting and Corporate Management by integrating engaging Game mechanics into everyday tasks in our fast-paced World.

↳#Parenting with Gamification

—Gamification in parenting uses game elements such as point scoring and competition to make routine tasks like chores engaging and fun, fostering responsibility and self-discipline in children.

↳Corporate World Advantages

—In the corporate world, gamification boosts employee engagement and productivity by using elements like leaderboards and badges to promote competition and collaboration.


Benefits of Gamification↴

—Increased Engagement: Whether it’s children doing chores or employees completing projects, gamification boosts engagement by making the process more enjoyable and rewarding.

—Enhanced Motivation: The reward system inherent in gamification keeps individuals motivated, whether to earn a new badge or to top a leaderboard.

—Improved Learning and Retention: Both children and adults learn better when they are actively engaged. 

—Gamification makes the absorption of new concepts easier and more memorable.

—Positive Behavior Reinforcement: Encouraging positive behavior through rewards and recognition leads to habit formation in children and productivity increases in employees.


Video credit goes to the respective owner (s), #Creativity
